meanings.sent1: The young bushers practiced their swings at the baseball field.
meanings.sent2: The coach was impressed by the skills of the new bushers on the team.
meanings.sent3: The bushers celebrated their victory with high-fives and cheers.
meanings.sent4: In the championship game, the bushers hit the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the bushers rounded the bases for a home run.

meanings.definition: A device used to protect the hands while gardening.
meanings.sent1: She put on her gardening gloves, making sure the bushers were secure.
meanings.sent2: The soft bushers shielded her hands from thorns and dirt in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The colorful bushers made her feel like a superhero while planting flowers.
meanings.sent4: With her trusty bushers on, she tackled the weeding and pruning with ease.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite bushers had tiny flowers embroidered on them, adding a touch of style to her gardening attire.

meanings.definition: A type of plant with woody stems.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with various bushers, from roses to lavender.
meanings.sent2: The tall bushers provided shade and beauty to the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the bushers as hiding spots for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The wind rustled through the bushers, creating a soothing sound in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the bushers attracted butterflies and bees, adding life to the garden.
